Bond Lower 6-6, Band U6s 12y M presents early with mother and younger sisters. Pt had complained about pain a day after initial bonding, but said it resolved within a couple of days. No broken brackets, no CC, good OH today. Pt has been really good about flossing with his braces! I told him he is doing a great job and to keep it up. It is difficult to clean around fractured UR1, though. Bonded lower 6-6 with AO Mini Master MBT .022. Banded U6s with Weds. AM bands. Placed bite turbo on palatal cusp of UL5 to disclude and prevent debonding of lower brackets. U: .016 NiTi 6-6, cinch back. OCS UR2-UL1 L: .016 NiTi 6-6 cinch back NV: evaluate for bite turbos on lingual of upper anteriors, cervical pull HG, step up wires. NNV bond 7s

Ortho Progress Saw pt. with [DOCTOR] as [DOCTOR] was out this week. Pt. reports not wearing elastics, 2more mm of Class II correction needed on canines. Encouraged her to wear elastics. We had looked at the case as potential ABO but we doubt we can finish on time without elastics wear. Pt. to be transferred. Filled out transfer form and left on [DOCTOR] desk. U: kept 45 degree of lingual crown torque to UL5 17x25 TMA, stepped down both U6s L: went up to 17x25 TMA, Stepped down both 6s ClassII elastics both sides 3.16" 4.5oz full time, pictures taken at this visit.

Appliance Adjustment MDH updated- no changes Pt arrives on time. Pleasant demeanor Clinical Note: Elastics use: poor. patient and mom reported no/minmal elastic use Class 2 correction on the right: none Class 3 correction on the left: none At this point, we just want to finish the case. Cut wire distal to the U4's to let the posteriors sock in UAW: 19 x 25 SS.Extrude upper left 3, with upper left 3 cant down bend. Triangle elastic UL4-UL3-LL4-LL3. Removed U6' bands LAW: 19 x 25 SS (L6-6). Accentuated lower 2-2 to extrude lowers and close bite more OJ = 2 mm. no anterior coupling present OB = 2 mm Elastics: no more AP elastics ; midline elastics to help the uneven OJ (UR3-LL3) ; boX elastics left, delta elastic right Midline: coincident Right: class 2 canine, 1 mm Left: class 3 canine, 1.5 mm Attending: [DOCTOR] NV - appliance adjustment; check class 3 correction on the left and class 2 correction on the right

Male Pt presents with Mom for Initial Orthodontic Consultation Note: baseball, catcher On time: on time Covering Faculty: [DOCTOR] Chief Concern: " not so much concerned about esthetics, more about health and fxn of teeth " RMHx: No contraindications to today's consultation. Significant Findings: LL3, UL2 x-bite. Gen. mod U/L spacing. LL#E still present. RDHx: healthy EOE: wnl IOE: wnl R Molar Classification: 1 L Molar Classification: 1 TMJ: ( No ) Crepitus, ( No ) , No Clicking of TMJ, Pain on Palpation, ( No ) Hx of Trauma Recommendations: Yes Records to be taken, CBCT ( Full + Report ) , IO and EO photographs, Scan/Models of Maxillary and Mandibular Arches. retroclined UAs, min. OJ, OB. May have class III tendency. NV: Consultation of Tx Options, Begin Tx upon approval

Pt is ready for orthodontic tx. Recommend full tx child. Alginate impressions and bite registration made to submit to dentical. HLD score 29. NV: Consultation of Tx Options, Begin Tx upon approval
